results.title: First steps
results.creator_credit: Brenda Horsfield, James McCloy and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Man in the Making”.
This film deals with the development of the brain and the changes brought about as it matures. It attempts to answer such questions as: does a child learn to walk, or is it something that develops regardless of learning?

results.title: Power to the people
results.creator_credit: Claire Taplin and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
The way people live now calls for constantly increasing supplies of energy for more and more power production. However, resources of fossil fuels are limited and the power they generates is a major source of pollution. Here is examined the environmental impact of atomic energy: radiation safety, thermal pollution, and disposal of nuclear wastes.

results.title: Things worth keeping
results.creator_credit: Boris Holtzman and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Surveys worldwide problems of preserving cultural heritage, including unique buildings, historical sites and established neighbourhoods, as opposed to the construction of airports, super highways and industrial sites.

results.title: The Seamless web
results.creator_credit: Osborn Segerberg, Peter Hollander, University of the State of New York and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Examines the relationship between human beings and the environment and the choices that must be made to preserve it, considered in light of the interconnection between all parts of life in the total environment.

results.title: The Vanishing breed
results.creator_credit: Boris Holtzman and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
Discusses what can be done to preserve the hundreds of species of rare or endangered birds and animals and why they should be protected. Presents wildlife of east Africa as an example of the growing conflict between conservation of wildlife and the demands of farming and industry. Narrated by Norman Rose.

results.title: The Car and the city
results.creator_credit: Boris Holtzman and United Nations Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
The automobile is a serious polluter of the air and a major interruption to urban activities. So planners are looking at ways to change or limit the use of the conventional automobile in large cities, and to ease mass transit flow. Features William Lear’s 1975 steam car, a representative of the US EPA and John Esposito from the Ralph Nader Center for Study of Responsive Law, and Helen Leavitt, author of “Super-highway, super hoax”.
results.description:

results.title: The Keeping of the green
results.creator_credit: Joe O'Brien and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
As the population density of cities increases there is greater pressure to devote existing green areas to profitable industrial and residential uses. This film examines the need for green areas in cities - for recreation, for beauty and for relieving the effects of urban crowding.
results.description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.

group_works.title: You can help - throw it here

results.title: You can help - throw it here
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man builds - man destroys”.
In the past we have burnt and buried waste but today such solutions are inadequate. Here, retrieval recycling, and other environmentally positive forms of waste disposal, including “Mount Trashmore” - a recreational park complete with ski-run, built with waste from neighbouring communities - are examined
